intro: Medicago virescens, commonly known as yellow medic, is a perennial legume native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has a deep taproot system, allowing it to thrive in well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed areas, such as roadsides and pastures. Medicago virescens is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it a valuable plant for soil enrichment.
